subject: Re: [junit] JNI (Shudder!)
msgSnippet: ... It turns out, that was exactly the problem.  This was a puzzle someone sent me via email, so it was like gathering evidence after the crime. ( Oh hey,
messageBody:
bernd wrote:

>
>
> Did you solve it yet?
>
> After moving your classes into a package,
> have you re-generated the *.h and *.c and the *.dll files?
> The c function names contain the full package path.
> Maybe the system is looking for e.g.:
>
> JNIEXPORT jstring JNICALL Java_com_xyz_runMyDLL
> (JNIEnv * env, jobject this)
>
> but in the dll only is
>
> JNIEXPORT jstring JNICALL Java_runMyDLL
> (JNIEnv * env, jobject this)
>
> ?
>

It turns out, that was exactly the problem. This was a puzzle someone
sent me via email, so it was like gathering evidence after the crime.
("Oh hey, there's another source file over there!") Of course, you
can never trust the eye witnesses. :-)

And I'm admittedly not a JNI expert...

Thanks folks!

Mike

--
